body: Away, my songs, must we goIII. Chronology of Northern ExplorationSo you can watch me watch uplifted snowStanding in the way of the truth. A whiteSculpting each tree to fit your ghostly form.Late February, and the air's so balmyLike theirs ends? From what distant point of visionStunned in their voiceless way to be aliveRise, to the muffled chime of churchbell choir.What can we know of whatever picture-planeat balls hit again and again toward her offspring.For any part of them we can make outCalling me to you with wild gesturingsWhere, as I discover as I go throughOf tree-dividing sky finally comes down toAbsurdly, my eyes can only see the arcLife, or only joy, that stands outVIII. Russia: The Great Northern ExpeditionIn the woods, close by,
